title: Either Brussels works with Boris or it risks a no-deal Brexit
text:
The EU is engaged in a high risk strategy exacerbated by the fact that it doesn’t understand Britain. Theresa May is no longer in charge; Brussels no longer has all the winning cards. Its stubborn refusal to consider properly Boris Johnson’s new offer is increasing the chances of a no-deal Brexit – if not this month then by the beginning of next year. It should accept Boris Johnson’s withdrawal proposal. The next offer from Britain could be far less generous.

But the Europeans still hope that somehow they will be able to keep us in their orbit, so it looks like they’ve made a number of miscalculations – that the Benn Act means that Mr Johnson’s proposal can be safely ignored for the time being,...
description: The EU is engaged in a high risk strategy exacerbated by the fact that it doesn’t understand Britain.
